content.question: (a) Find <math alttext="g of 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g of 4" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

frqParts.text: (a) Find <math alttext="g of 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g of 4" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

(b) Find the absolute minimum value of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 4 comma 4, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.
(c) Find all intervals on which the graph of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down. Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
